content:
Finally found a method that worked:

How do I import an old profile into Thunderbird? Restoring Mozilla Thunderbird Profile From Backup Copy What to Know On the Thunderbird menu bar, select Help > Troubleshooting Information. Next to Profile Folder, choose Show in Finder. Confirm that the existing profile folder and the profile backup have identical names. Quit Thunderbird. Replace the existing profile folder with the backup file.

content:
Para diagnosticar problemas en Thunderbird, prueba una de las siguientes soluciones:

  • Reinicia Thunderbird con los complementos desactivados (Thunderbird en Modo Seguro). En el menú de Ayuda, haz clic en "Reiniciar con los complementos desactivados...". Si Thunderbird funciona bien, hay algún complemento o tema que interfiere en el funcionamiento normal de Thunderbird. Tendrás que volver a activar todos los complementos hasta que localices dónde está el problema.
  • Reinicia el sistema operativo en Modo a prueba de fallos. De esta forma se cargará solo lo necesario para que pueda arrancar el ordenador y se activará la conexión a Internet. Para obtener instrucciones sobre cómo reiniciar tu sistema operativo en modo seguro, haz clic en él: Windows 8.
Si reiniciando el sistema operativo en modo seguro se ha resuelto el problema, el que causa los problemas es algún otro software de tu equipo. Algunas de esos softwares pueden ser (aunque no son los únicos): AV scanning, virus/malware, descargas de fondo (por ejemplo, actualizaciones de programas), etc.

content:
Ide to nastaviť cez "Globálnu schránku prijatej pošty". Táto funkcia umožňuje prijímať poštu z viacerých účtov POP do jednej schránky v lokálnych priečinkoch. Môžete si vybrať, či chcete do globálnej schránky doručovať zo všetkých, alebo iba z niektorých účtov POP. Každý účet, ktorý nebude používať globálnu schránku, bude mať svoju skupinu priečinkov, vrátane priečinka prijatej pošty, a budú zobrazené v paneli priečinkov. Účty, ktoré používajú globálnu schránku, nebudú mať tieto priečinky zobrazené, namiesto toho sa použije skupina v Lokálnych priečinkoch.

Keď v Thunderbirde vytvárate nový účet POP, sprievodca sa vás spýta, či s ním chcete použiť globálnu schránku. Ak áno, ubezpečte sa, že políčko tejto možnosti je označené. Ak globálnu schránku s týmto účtom použiť nechcete, políčko musí byť prázdne. http://imgbank.cz/images/2019/03/25/Thunderbird-globalna-databaza.jpg

Zmena nastavenia pre už existujúci účet POP: Dôležité. Ak sú v priečinkoch tohto účtu už nejaké správy, mali by ste ich skopírovať alebo premiestniť do lokálnych priečinkov ešte predtým ako začnete používať účet s globálnou schránkou. Ak správy nepremiestnite a globálnu schránku budete používať, tento účet sa už nezobrazí v paneli priečinkov a vy nebudete môcť pristupovať k správam, pokiaľ neodstránite nastavenie globálneho priečinka pre tento účet. http://imgbank.cz/images/2019/03/25/Thunderbird-globalna.jpg - Thunderbird - Nástroje - Nastavenia účtov - (vyberte postupne účet) - Nastavenie servera - Pokročilé - Globálna doručená pošta (zvoliť). A takto to urobte u všetkých účtoch v ktorých chcete mať "Globálnu schránku prijatej pošty".

Toto neplatí pre IMAP účty - tie musia mať samostatnú (vlastnú) štruktúru. Každý IMAP účet bude mať svoju skupinu priečinkov, vrátane priečinka prijatej pošty.

Najjednoduchším a najrýchlejším riešením je prechod na POP prístup všetkých účtov.

content: What is the authentication method for the incoming and outgoing servers? It should be OAuth2, and the account password should be entered in an OAuth browser window, not the usual TB password prompt.

creator: nussie12

content: On the first connection, the OAuth window appears like a browser window with an address bar pointing to an MS site. The token that's stored in Saved Passwords on successful authentication is a long string of characters. Just as with a regular password, if the token is deleted, and TB restarted, the browser window appears where you enter the account password.
creator: sfhowes

content: For IMAP accounts, select Synchronization & Storage in Account Settings. If you don't keep messages for offline access, i.e. download headers only, Body isn't available in Classic Search (Ctrl+Shift+F) unless 'Run search on server' is enabled in the search window.

I do keep messages for offline access so that wasn't the issue but your other comment about checking the box for "Run search on server" solved my problem.

creator: meskobalazs

content:
Kedves Balázs!

A problémám az, hogy teljesen megváltozott az előző verzió(k)ban megszokott felület kinézete. Megváltozott a menük elhelyezkedése, a fontok és ikonok kinézete. Biztosan meg fogom ezeket szokni, de van néhány dolog, ami kifejezetten kellemetlen változás: 1. Amikor megnyitom a levelező programot nincs megjelölve a "Beérkezett üzenetek" utolsó, legfrissebb üzenete 2. Amikor indulás után kijelölök egy levelet, az alsó ablakban hatalmas betűkkel jeleníti meg a szöveget, minden egyes alkalommal a '<Ctrl>-" billentyűkombináció többszöri leütésével tudom lekicsinyíteni a karaktereket a kívánt méretre. 3. A következőképpen állítottam be a megjelenítést: bal oldalt hosszú, teljes függőleges ablakban vannak a mappák, jobb oldalon szélesebb ablakokban, egymás alatt vannak a levelek és a megjelenített aktuális levél tartalma. Ez utóbbi kettő közötti sáv túl magas (a From, To, Reply to és Subject sorok közötti távolság túl nagy), ezért az alsó megjelenítési ablak túl kicsi lesz. Ennek az elválasztó sávnak a színe nem tér el a felette és alatta lévő ablakok színétől, ezért az egész teljesen összemosódik. 4. A bal oldali ablakban lévő mappa ikonok és megnevezésük fontja is más lett, de lehet, hogy ezt idővel meg tudom szokni...

Hogy lehet a különböző ablakokban megjelenített ikonokat és karaktereket megváltoztatni?

Próbáltam visszatérni a 102.9.1-es verzióra, de telepítés után azt írta ki, hogy az új verzió már olyannyira megváltoztatta a profilomat, hogy a régi verzió már nem tudja azt kezelni. Viszont utólag arra gondoltam, hogy érdemesebb mindig az újabb verziókat használni, hisz azok a régiek hibáját is javítják, - ezért inkább az újakat kellene testre szabni...

content:
I'm afraid that issue has nothing to do with a problem using your Thunderbird email client. As this Thunderbird forum is manned by other Thunderbird users, I do not think we can help with that sort of issue.

Did you make a donation to 'Thunderbird' or 'Mozilla' (which is not Thunderbird they are separate)? Maybe you have purchased something from a Mozilla online store ?

Mozilla does not charge any amount of money for any Firefox related products including Firefox for Android and Firefox for desktop. Thunderbird is also free unless you paid someone for their services to install it etc.

As general advise, you should be able to dispute a charge with the credit card business if you think its a fraudulent case.

content:
re :I used to have an inbox folder, under which I had all inbox folders from all my accounts. And this was done automatically, by thunderbird, I didn't created it.

I think you are talking about using a Unified folders view and you would have to enable it. The normal default is: View > Folders > 'All'

You are describing something which sounds like this is selected: View > Folders > Unified If you have Unified view selected and you do not want it then uncheck Unfied and select 'All'

re :But after the update, this inbox folder is empty. The only way to see mails is to go to the inbox folder within each account.

If the 'Unified Inbox' does not have a sublist of account Inboxes or some are missing do this:

  • Right click on the Unified Inbox folder and select 'Properties'
  • Click on 'Choose '
  • For each account select the 'Inbox'
  • click on 'OK
  • Click on 'Update'

If it seems corrupted do this:

  • View > Folders > select 'All'
  • View > Folders > uncheck 'Unified'
  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Under 'Application Basics' - half way - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder

  • Exit Thunderbird now.
  • Scroll down and delete this file : 'virtualFolders.dat'
  • Click on 'Mail' folder to see contents
  • Delete this folder : 'smart mailboxes'

Start Thunderbird Allow time for accounts to check for mail etc.

If you want to see Unified folders do this:

  • View > Folders > select 'Unified'
  • View > Folders > uncheck 'All'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: The part of deleting 'virtualFolders.dat' & 'smart mailboxes' fixed the problem.
creator: petasisg

content:
That is the Tasks list accessed via the 'Menu Bar' toolbar - 'View' > 'Tasks' Customise the Unified Toolbar and put 'Tasks' onto the 'Calendar' tab, so then you can quickly switch to 'Tasks' window. It is identical to the same as used in version 102* When you single click to highlight a Task it tells you the info about the selected task in the lower section. If you want to update eg: Category then you can use the options to perform a quick update without needing to open the entire Task window saving time and reducing the number of clicks required. If you want to open in a new window or maybe you have set it up to open in a new tab, then double click on the Task in the list.

However, I'm getting a problem when it comes to reducing the height of the lower pane. The double headed grab icon is not vertical, it's horizontal. In 102*, I can grab the top edge and lower it to the point of removal from view. Maybe there is a bug reported, I'll check it out, but if not then I'll get it reported.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
> Is there any way I can get back to using Compact View on Favorite Folders, without the " - Local Folders" text appended to each folder name?

There is not. The added text for account name is there specifically for compact view, because many users mark multiple folders as favorites that have the same folder name, foremost being "Inbox".

content: I sent a message to a mailing list from a gmail IMAP account, entering the gmail address in the To: box and the list in the Bcc: box. The message was received by all recipients and the gmail account, and was copied to the gmail Sent Mail account. Are you doing it differently?
creator: sfhowes

content:
Not exactly. Here is an example:

I press C-n or select "New Message" from the account of myemailaddress@gmail.com TB opens a "Write" window with myemailaddress@gmail.com as the "From" field and I type in with completion "mLEmacs <Help-gnu-emacs@gnu.org>" I write something and hit "Send" and the email (OP) is sent.

When I check for a new message there is no copy downloaded of the email that I just sent. With my previous email address, I would have almost immediately gotten a copy of the OP.

The response above is consistent with every listserv and google group that I have use for decades. With non-gmail addresses.

With the gmail address I do not get a copy of the OP, no do I get copies of subsequent replies I might send to that thread. This is very inconvenient as it makes the thread harder to follow.

Thanks for the reply. I hope I have been clearer. My email address has been obfuscated, of course. Quotation marks around text are illustrative and not literal.
creator: tim_in_ak

content: First, this is not an act by Thunderbird. My guess is Google senses that, since you sent the message, you don't need a copy. Listservs and Google Groups may be doing that.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for your interest.

I started opening TB. Clicked Help>Troubleshoot Mode. In "Restart in Troubleshoot Mode" dialog box, clicked Restart. It started loading and crashed again. The crash report is: bp-6d6f7ea6-c346-4d14-ab7b-2d5d80231104

I saw that you could start in Troubleshoot Mode by holding down the Shift key when starting TB. I did that: 

Got a "Thunderbird Troubleshoot Mode" dialog box. Unchecked both boxes and  hit “Continue in Troubleshooting Mode”.

Got another crash: bp-88149dd4-8c50-46f0-aa5a-7dbf40231104

[@ EdgePool::Iterator::operator* ] and [@ OOM | large | js::AutoEnterOOMUnsafeRegion::crash | js::AutoEnterOOMUnsafeRegion::crash | js::gc::AllocateCellInGC ] respectively.

My recommendation is to start Thunderbird from the command line with 

thunderbird.exe -offline

Then right+click on all your inboxes and pick properties > repair

content: The 'leave messages on server' does what you want; the messages are kept online at the server. Also, be sure to UNtick the 'until I delete them' option.

content:
Hello there


Some functions can break within updates if they misunderstand and cause errors.

If your wireless mouse is still functioning, you could see if the hardware acceleration could be adjusted to resolve this.

In this case, disable it by going to general / settings at the bottom of the tab and try restarting. Now is your scrolling problem solved?

content:
To better clarify the problem - if I delete an email at the very top of the messages pane, there's no scroll/jump. But if I delete an email from the middle or bottom of the message pane it scrolls very quickly to another section of the pane.

I've found this mentioned in other places:

https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/1729cui/deleting_messages_in_the_middle_of_inbox_causes/

content:
In troubleshooting mode the scrolling issue doesn't happen with the mouse. In normal mode I disabled addons and am using the system theme, and it's still happening.

creator: kanjigirl

content: I turned off Auto-scrolling in Thunderbird settings and that seems to have fixed it.
creator: kanjigirl

content:
Okay, more complaints have been received about this Not exactly the same, but the subject is.

Disabling hardware acceleration was a solution. The next text topic was a solution to this similar problem, such as the complete non-functioning of the scrolling function.

The fix :


'’Start TB in normal mode, disable hardware acceleration in Settings/General/Indexing, restart TB, test the scrolling.

This will still be useful if it changes suddenly

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content: With Autoscrolling turned back on and hardware acceleration off, it still scrolls elasticly. Autoscrolling off seems to be the best result.
creator: kanjigirl
